compilerOptions._comment_declarationMap: generate (.d.ts.map) files for easier debugging of declaration files
compilerOptions._comment_esModuleInterop: enable interoperability between CommonJS and ES Modules, allowing default imports from CommonJS modules
compilerOptions._comment_incremental: enable incremental compilation to improve build times by only recompiling changed files
compilerOptions._comment_isolatedModules: ensure that each file can be safely transpiled without relying on other files, which is important for tools like Babel or SWC that transpile files individually
compilerOptions._comment_module: specify the module code generation method, with 'NodeNext' allowing for both CommonJS and ES Module syntax based on file extensions
compilerOptions._comment_moduleDetection: force TypeScript to treat all files as modules, even if they don't have import/export statements
compilerOptions._comment_moduleResolution: specify how modules are resolved, with 'NodeNext' aligning with Node.js's module resolution strategy for ES Modules
compilerOptions._comment_resolveJsonModule: allow importing JSON files as modules, enabling type checking and autocompletion for JSON imports
compilerOptions._comment_skipLibCheck: skip type checking of declaration files (.d.ts) to improve build performance, especially when using third-party libraries
compilerOptions._comment_strict: enable all strict type-checking options, providing a more rigorous type system and catching more potential errors during development
compilerOptions._coment_target: specify the target JavaScript version for the emitted code, with 'ES2022' providing modern features and syntax
